Linux_Cheat_Sheet.File_Permissions.md:
# File Permissions

## Change File Permissions
```
# To add execute permission to the owner
chmod +x filename

# To remove write permission from the group
chmod g-w filename

# To make a file readable and writable by the owner only
chmod 600 filename
```

Linux_Cheat_Sheet.Basic_Commands.md:
# Basic Linux Commands

## Working with Directories
```
# Change directory
cd directory_name

# Create a new directory
mkdir new_directory

# Remove a directory
rmdir directory_name
```

Linux_Cheat_Sheet.Process_Management.md:
# Process Management

## View Running Processes
```
# Display a list of all processes
ps aux

# View detailed process information
top

# Display information about system processes
htop
```

Linux_Cheat_Sheet.Networking.md:
# Networking

## Check Network Connectivity
```
# Ping a host
ping hostname

# Check open ports on a remote host
nc -zv hostname port

# Display network interface information
ifconfig
```

Linux_Cheat_Sheet.File_System.md:
# File System

## Disk Usage
```
# Display disk usage of files and directories
du -h

# Display disk space usage by a specific directory
du -h /path/to/directory
```

Linux_Cheat_Sheet.Text_Manipulation.md:
# Text Manipulation

## Search and Replace in Files
```
# Search for a string in files
grep -r 'search_string' /path/to/directory

# Replace a string in files
sed -i 's/old_string/new_string/g' filename
```

Linux_Cheat_Sheet.User_Accounts.md:
# User Accounts

## User Management
```
# Create a new user
sudo adduser username

# Change user password
sudo passwd username

# Delete a user
sudo deluser username
```

Linux_Cheat_Sheet.Software_Management.md:
# Software Management

## Package Management
```
# Update package lists
sudo apt update

# Install a package
sudo apt install package_name

# Remove a package
sudo apt remove package_name
```

Linux_Cheat_Sheet.System_Info.md:
# System Information

## Display System Information
```
# Display system information
uname -a

# Show kernel version
uname -r

# Display available memory
free -h
```
